titleStmt.title: The rich cabinet furnished with varietie of excellent discriptions, exquisite charracters, witty discourses, and delightfull histories, deuine and morrall. Together with inuectiues against many abuses of the time: digested alphabetically into common places. Wherevnto is annexed the epitome of good manners, exttracted from Mr. Iohn de la Casa, Arch-bishop of Beneuenta.
titleStmt.author: T. G., fl. 1616.

titleStmt.title: The rich cabinet furnished with varietie of excellent discriptions, exquisite charracters, witty discourses, and delightfull histories, deuine and morrall. Together with inuectiues against many abuses of the time: digested alphabetically into common places. Gainsford, Thomas, d. 1624?
Della Casa, Giovanni, 1503-1556. Galateo.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I[ohn] B[eale] for Roger Iackson and are to be sold at his shop neere Fleete Conduit,

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: T.G., i.e. Thomas Gainsford?.
